title: American_Top_40_1982_June_12th
description:
THIS FILE WAS PREVIOUSLY TORRENTED AS "American_Top_40_June_12th,_1982" IF YOU DOWNLOADED THAT FILE YOU ALREADY HAVE THIS ONE. THIS IS THE NEW TORRENT OF THAT SAME FILE AND THAT TORRENT WILL NO LONGER BE SEEDED. THIS IS ONE OF THE FIRST 15 I EVER TORRENTED. I'M JUST CHANGING THE NAME SO ALL SHOW TITLES ARE FORMATTED ALIKE.

"I'm Casey Kasem counting 'em down to number one."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

There have been three songs in the rock era titled, "Without You" (one is at number 24 by Franke & The Knockouts). Casey plays samples of the other two.

There was only one time in the history of Warner Brothers where they signed on a band on the basis of an audition tape they got in the mail and nothing else. Casey plays one of their songs as an in-show extra.

Casey tells about the fantastic career of music producer Chips Momen.

The most successful singer/songwriter in the history of the charts finally makes number one on the soul chart after 18 years.

Lw#3: I've Never Been To Me - Charlene
